comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas A-4C Skyhawk 145118 Composite squadron VC-7 ‘Redtails’ Side number 16 and unit tail code UH A 1974 color picture of A-4C 145118 apparently taken at same place and time: a4skyhawk.org/content/145118-vc-7-photo-scott-van-aken-1304 A-4C 145118 VC-7 ‘Redtails’ side number 16 Unit tail code UH Location: NAS Miramar Date: February 1974 photo by Scott Van Aken Tallyho Skyhawk BuNo 145118, centerline buddy store, parked on the ramp ………………………………………………………………….... A4D-2N/A-4C 145118 was accepted from the manufacturer on January 8, 1960. For the first four years flew with the US Marine Corps from MCAS El Toro California. Then to “that old crazy Asian war” with the US Navy and VA-153 ‘Tail Flies’ flying off CVA-43 USS Coral Sea in 1965. During this deployment it was sent to Japan for repair, returning to the carrier and completing the tour. 1966 saw A-4C 145118 shipped out to NAS Cubi Point in the Philippines - ready for more war. Back to flying with five different Marine Corps squadrons from 1966 to 1967, logging many missions ‘in country’ - out of muddy Chu Lai Air Base in the then South Vietnam. Two rest and maintenance periods were also spent in Japan. Returning to the US mainland in 1968 and Marine/Navy training or reserve units. A-4C 145118 eventually flew as a target tow plane on both the East and West coasts of continental USA for three more years before being retired in March 1975 to the desert boneyard at MASDC near Tucson Arizona and eventually scrapped there. A 1965 monochrome carrier deck action image including A-4C 145118: a4skyhawk.org/content/145118-va-153-official-us-navy-phot... A-4C 145118 VA-153 ‘Blue Tail Flies’ side number 300 Airwing code NL USS Coral Sea 1965 official U.S. Navy photo by PH1 Jean Cote Blue Tail Flies Skyhawk BuNo 145118, NL-300, aboard the Coral Sea as a Sea Knight delivers supplies. Blue Tail Flies BuNo 148317, NL-309 at right
